methods.name: add

parameters.name: interval
parameters.summary: A string representing the interval. One of the following: "year", "month", "day", "hour", "minute", "second", "millisecond", "quarter", "week", "weekday"

parameters.name: amount
parameters.summary: How much to add to the date.

methods.summary: Add to a Date in intervals of different size, from milliseconds to years

methods.name: compare

parameters.name: date2
parameters.summary: Date object. If not specified, the current Date is used.

parameters.name: portion
parameters.summary: A string indicating the "date" or "time" portion of a Date object. Compares both "date" and "time" by default. One of the following: "date", "time", "datetime"

methods.summary: Compare two date objects by date, time, or both.
methods.description: Returns 0 if equal, positive if a > b, else negative.

methods.name: difference

parameters.name: date2
parameters.summary: Date object. If not specified, the current Date is used.

parameters.name: interval
parameters.summary:
A string representing the interval. One of the following: "year", "month", "day", "hour", "minute", "second", "millisecond", "quarter", "week", "weekday"

Defaults to "day".

methods.summary: Get the difference in a specific unit of time (e.g., number of months, weeks, days, etc.) between two dates, rounded to the nearest integer.

methods.name: getDaysInMonth
methods.summary: Returns the number of days in the month used by dateObject

methods.name: getTimezoneName

parameters.name: dateObject
parameters.summary: Needed because the timezone may vary with time (daylight savings)

methods.summary: Get the user's time zone as provided by the browser
methods.description: Try to get time zone info from toString or toLocaleString method of the Date object -- UTC offset is not a time zone. See http://www.twinsun.com/tz/tz-link.htm Note: results may be inconsistent across browsers.

methods.name: isLeapYear
methods.summary: Determines if the year of the dateObject is a leap year
methods.description: Leap years are years with an additional day YYYY-02-29, where the year number is a multiple of four with the following exception: If a year is a multiple of 100, then it is only a leap year if it is also a multiple of 400. For example, 1900 was not a leap year, but 2000 is one.
